Posts.Content: It sure does but I guess we always will be extra cautious, I found a little lump near my node scar about 6 weeks after my op, typically on a Fri evening and I had a total melt down! After speaking to my BCN on the Monday I felt a bit calmer as I'd had CT scan for rads the week before which was clear but jesus it scared the c**p out of me! No one was bothered by it so I tried to forget it but it was two months before it disappeared, my heart is in my mouth when I touch the area now , it's got to easier at some point !! Xx
Posts.Title: re occurance

Posts.Content: oh Ali, I can imagine how scary this is for you but sounds more like an infection than anything else, they will check you out and get you sorted , this b*****d disease has us all on tender hooks, it's got a lot to answer for!!! Will be thinking of you lovely Xxx Jo
Posts.Title: re occurance

Posts.Content: Can I ask why they have put your wire in before hand? Mine was strapped to my chest like an Ariel! have you been walking around with yours like that?! Xx
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Can I ask why they have put your wire in before hand? Mine was strapped to my chest like an Ariel! have you been walking around with yours like that?! Xx
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Blimey Sarah I would have been ready to punch some one too after all that! mine was straight forward and all done under one roof thankfully, think I must be immune to needles as never felt a thing!
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: I'm with you Ali, my mum died 12 years ago from BC and she never smoked and only had a baby Cham at Christmas! It still took her though... I'm healthy, don't smoke, keep slim, eat well , exercise etc etc,yes I like a glass of wine but not every day and hey I got it too! Xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: I'm with you Ali, my mum died 12 years ago from BC and she never smoked and only had a baby Cham at Christmas! It still took her though... I'm healthy, don't smoke, keep slim, eat well , exercise etc etc,yes I like a glass of wine but not every day and hey I got it too! Xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: I had my wire put in on the morning of my op then a mammogram to check it was in the right place, they prob just want to double check it's still in where it should be as you've already had it put in xx
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Blimey Sarah I would have been ready to punch some one too after all that! mine was straight forward and all done under one roof thankfully, think I must be immune to needles as never felt a thing!
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: It's an awful enough time without having to deal with someone like that, I know they see it every day but they should treat you with more compassion! 17mm is small and I doubt that alone would be cause for a Mastectomy but until they have results from your MRI they can't know this for sure, start writing a list of questions to take with you on Thursday as its so hard to think straight on the day and my mind just went blank! You are entitled to see copies of any tests you have had done and if they advise mastectomy, chemo etc then make sure they explain exactly why so you dont leave still wondering what is going on, all the very best my love and I hope everything goes as well as possible for you Xx Jo
Posts.Title: WHAT QUESTIONS SHOULD I BE ASKING

Posts.Content: Hi sarah, l had a lumpectomy and two nodes removed just under 3 weeks ago, results were all good and clear nodes but  will still be having some rads, I'm seeing oncologist on Tuesday so will know more then about when and for how long, I was stared on Tamoxifen  6 days ago, was a bit sick yesterday morning but have taken the advice to have them on a full stomach now and Have been fine so far today although I know it's early days, ive been put on Venlofaxine as well which is an antidepressent but also helps with the side effects of Tamoxifen, ive been very down about it all but the past 48 hours have suddenly been feeling like my old self again which is lovely, Ive been told I will be on it for at least 5 years but they are looking in to 10 at the moment as well, I can imagine how sore your must feel as I found the node op was the only thing that really bothered me and I only had two removed, Ive healed well but things are still a little tender still although I'm driving and back to work ok, it is all stepping in to the unknown so am trying to just slow my mind down and take it one step at at time . Love jo ️Xx
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear this, We had to have our gorgeous Retriever Honey put to sleep in Dec 14 due to cancer, she was almost 10 and we were utterly heartbroken, Took the plunge and got our lovely new pup Gracie in Jan 15 and bugger me i was diagnosed with breast cancer just a few weeks later! You couldn't make it up! Gracie turned out to be the best tonic and is such a good girl and gave us such comfort and something to focus on during such a hard time, we still cry for Honey but know she had such a happy life with us and we will always treasure our memories of her
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi Lizz, there is no need to be scared of rads honestly, they do have to point out the possible side effects but for most of us they are pretty minimal, 15 months on now and the only noticeable difference is my boob is slightly darker than my other one but still the same size and not painful unless it's squished! My scar is darker but blends in with the rest of it, I've still got a soft boob and although no one but me and hubby ever sees them they wouldn't notice anything different if they did! Please don't worry , after chemo you will wonder if they are even doing anything with rads, totally painless and over in seconds, I had no ill effects during treatment, went each day after work then home to carry on with my normal routine , best of luck to you Xx Jo
Posts.Title: Minimising radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: Hiya,  I've been on tamoxifen for 6 weeks now and haven't really had any side effects other than some aching I'm suffering with now, I'm also taking the antidepressant Venlaxine as well as my surgeon recommended it to help with side effects and also my mental state and on the whole I feel pretty good, I know it's early days but I'm 8/8 oestrogen positive so there is no way I wouldn't take Tamoxifen as I'd be too worried about recurrence not to xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice needed

Posts.Content: my antidepressants were changed when I started on Tamoxifen, I was taking Citalopram but was changed to venlifaxine as it doesn't interfere with Tamoxifen, I tried stopping taking them initially but felt so bad and my BCN and doctor told me off and said I was to take them for as long as I needed and I still take the odd Diazopam if I'm having an off day, I've never taken anything like it in my life but now needs must and I will take what ever I need to keep me on an even keel, I never want to go back to feeling as low as I did when I was first diagnosed, I couldn't even get out of bed and shook with fear continually xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi, it's all so confusing, my understanding of it is the stage refers to the size of the tumour and if there is any lymph involvement and the grade is to do with the aggressiveness of the cells, I know it's not easy but try and stay away from googling as it was just confuse and frighten you even more, do you have any letters with results so far? Mine all had the information about stage etc on them as it was reassuring to look at them when I feeling muddles about things Xx Jo
Posts.Title: stage/ tiering system confusion

Posts.Content: Hiya, it's so hard to have to break this news to your kids no matter how old they are! My boys were 23 and 25 when I was diagnosed last year, we were in full flow planning my eldest sons wedding in sept and I had to find a way to hit them with this! My mum had died from breast cancer in 2003 so that added to my guilt knowing their only contact with cancer had resulted in them losing their beloved nanny but I wasn't hiding anything from them as she had done with us and had always promised myself if it ever happened I would do be totally up front with them but boy it broke my heart to have to do this to them! However they were amazing and made me so proud , I know they were scared but they were strong and looked after me, each other and their dad and We never hid anything, they saw me have many a melt down and also celebrated with me when things were over, life is tough and there are some things you just can't protect them from sadly, my mum hid her cancer for so long by the time she sought help and told us it Was too late for her and it's something I have always struggled with so I knew I had to be honest with my boys from the off, my eldest was living at home with his fiancé so we told them face to face , our youngest was living away so we told him over the phone, my advice is just tell them , they will be sad but they will cope Xx Jo
Posts.Title: WOULD APPRECIATE ADVISE ON HOW TO TELL FAMILY

Posts.Content: I'm on day 8 out of 15 and have been using aqueous cream so far but just starting to get the sun burn feeling and quite tender around my nipple so off to buy some aloe Vera today, I'm going to buy some soft sports bras as well as I'm finding mine are getting really uncomfortable and I can't wait to whip it off when I get home! Everyone reacts differently so you its best to wait and see how you get on before stocking up xx Jo
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: This is the reason I'm pushing for a hysterectomy next year, I've been on Tamoxifen since April this year and other than erratic periods I've not had any issues but cant see any reason to keep hold of my bits and pieces now! I have private Heath care through work so am putting pressure on my GP to refer me for the op, after dealing with BC this year I'm not waiting for something else to happen that's for sure! Xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and endometrial changes

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed with Grade 1 Tubular and my letter confirmed it as Grade 1 Tubular invasive carcinoma as well, just a way of saying it's an invasive Tumour I think that has spread to breast tissue from the ducts, my nodes were clear so doesn't mean it's spread anywhere else, it's  all quite confusing but they will explain it to you xx Jo
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: I've also had copies of all letters sent back and forth between hospital And GP, I thought it was standard practice but you are certainly entitled to see them so I would ask xx
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: Im with you Lavender girl,Cannot understand anyone refusing treatment and thinking they know better, it's not a game it's a deadly killer disease!  my cancer was dealt with over 2 years ago and I'm healthy , happy and enjoying life! Deal with it and move on , why would you want To leave an evil disease to grow and spread and ultimately kill you when you have the chance to stop it in its tracks? It's beyond me Xx Jo
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: The thing that angers me most is that the vulnerable , scared newly diagnosed will be reading these posts and the thought that they could be frightened in to shunning treatment because they may fear what will happen to their bodies afterwards from reading some of these posts makes my blood boil!  I've had treatment and Guess what nothing fell off, I can still put one foot in front of the other and my body still works in every way it did before and Oh yes I'm also cancer free. I actually know what I'm talking about from experience!  Macmillan work so hard to raise money for research in to treatments and you come along and scoff in their faces!
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Gorgeous bunny! I am a huge animal lover , 5 cats and a dog here, your posts do always make me :-) I may be a grump about certain things here but animals will always win me over!! Xx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I've been on Tamoxifen for 4 months and have had very few side effects , the odd flush and some aching in my joints but nothing too bad, I also take the antidepressant Venlafaxine which my surgeon recommended when he put me on Tamoxifen as it helps with SE , Im Guessing it does its job as I feel well and happy
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I've been on Tamoxifen for 4 months and have had very few side effects , the odd flush and some aching in my joints but nothing too bad, I also take the antidepressant Venlafaxine which my surgeon recommended when he put me on Tamoxifen as it helps with SE , Im Guessing it does its job as I feel well and happy
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: That's all perfectly normal, I'm almost 3 months on from my op and I still get some pain in my arm pit at times, especially if I've been using that side a lot, it can take months for the nerves to knit back together and settle down, I've just finished radiotherapy which has made things a bit more tender but over all I'm feeling good, the node removal was definitely the most uncomfortable part of the op so try not to worry xx
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Hiya love, I'm a few months on from you after being diagnosed in March, I'm due to start radiotherapy tomorrow, It is the most traumatic and surreal thing I've ever experienced and although I'm feeling much more with it now I still can't quite believe what I've been through in the past few months, once you get your results things will start to feel better, you will know what your dealing with and have a plan , the not knowing and the waiting is the absolute worst bit, I found it complete torture! i took my dressings off after a week as I couldn't stand stinking and not being able to shower properly, I did get hubby to put some more on once I had showered but I healed really well and was fortunate to get good results, clear nodes and all cancer completely removed, things will get better and you do find a way to deal with it but it's one step at a time and until you know exactly what your dealing with it's completely normal to feel like you do, good luck for Friday and let us know how you get on xx Jo
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!

Posts.Content: I think it's standard to wait about 4 weeks from seeing oncologist but it may also be as I don't have any node spread and mine was a fairly straight forward case and I'm having it as a preventative measure against reacurrence and not to treat an actual tumour, to be honest I don't ask many questions, I don't want to know and just do what they tell me! all went well today thank you, was nothing like I expected and really quick and totally painless, just some minor tingling now but about to slather myself in cream before tomorrow's  zapping!! Xx Jo
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!

Posts.Content: I was exactly the same, had my op at end of March and was on a total high the first  week then the fear over results day crept in and I barely left my bed for days, it's a massive roller coaster of emotions bit from the day I was told exactly what was happening I've been on the up and up and two months later and half way though rads I'm feeling almost back to normal, some may feel I got off lightly with a low grade cancer and no infected nodes but it's still cancer and there are no guarantees no matter how minor it may seem, you are certainly not being over dramatic, I was a complete wreck but you do get through it although it may not feel like it at the minute, your brain does begin to process what's happening and you find a way to function, I just decided not to try and be happy and put on a face for anyone, I was damn right miserable and wasn't pretending for anybody , be kind for yourself and allow yourself the feelings you are having but never forget they will look after you well and have a plan in place for you on results day, best of luck to you my love xx jo
Posts.Title: Is it normal to feel so low, tired and achy?
